lib.commons module documentation¶

The lib.commons module gropus several utility functions.

getfile¶

commons.getfile.getfile(w_url, w_file_name=None, w_update=3600, ch_size=10240)[source]¶

Downloads a file object pointed by w_url and stores it on local file w_file_name. The w_update parameter marks how old the file can be. Files are only downloaded if they are older than w_update seconds.

Parameters:
  • w_url – URL of the file to get. All urllib2 URLs are supported, including file:///
  • w_update – Freshness timer in seconds. If the file was downloeaded less than this time ago the current copy is used, thus avoiding unnecessary re-downloading files.
  • w_file_name – Full file name and path of the locally-saved copy of the file. This parameter can be empty. In this case getfile will choose a random temp file name and, on success, will return this name
  • ch_size – Progress bar ticker step.

:return : file name of the locally-save copy.

lib.commons.dumpimport module documentation¶

The lib.commons.dumpimport module enables importing generic CSV files into memory or file-based sqlite3 databases.

sql3load¶

Created on Sep 18, 2013

@author: marcelo

class commons.dumpimport.sql3load.Sql3Load(w_record_tpl, w_file_name=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

This class implements a generic delimited text file importer into an sqlite3 backend. Allows for limited, SQL-like querying.

getStats()[source]¶

Returns a dictionary with all collected statistics

get_rowcount()[source]¶

Returns the current number of rows in the in-memory database.

importFile(w_file_name, w_delimiter=', ', w_callback=<function <lambda> at 0x108dfc410>, w_callback_steps=10)[source]¶

Imports delimiter-separated file into memory database. If the filename ends in ‘.gz’, importFile() will try to open it using the gzip module.

Parameters:
  • w_fname – file name of the CSV file to import.
  • w_delimiter – delimiter char, defaults to comma but can be also
query(w_query, w_parameters={})[source]¶

Runs an arbitrary SQL query against the in-memory database.

Parameters:
  • w_query – the query itself (what comes after the WHERE SQL keyword) using named parameters for column values, as in: ‘origin_as=:oas’
  • w_parameters – an associative array with parameter values. Must be consistent with the names used for wquery, as in: {‘oas’: ‘28000’}

lib.delegated module documentation¶

The lib.delegated provides a common API for loading and querying the RIR-style stat files, those that can be found at the FTP servers of each RIR.

lib.rpki.ripeval_stats module documentation¶

lib.rpki.ripeval_stats

RIPEVal Stats¶

Created on Sep 3, 2013

@author: marcelo

class rpki.ripeval_stats.BatchValidationResults[source]¶

Imports a RIPE Validator dump into a sqlite memory database. Allows generic SQL-like querying.

In-memory database columns are:

  • uri
  • origin_as
  • prefix
  • max_len
  • valid_from, valid_until
  • istart
  • iend
Author:carlos@lacnic.net
query(w_query, w_parameters)[source]¶

Runs an arbitrary SQL query against the in-memory database.

Parameters:
  • w_query – the query itself (what comes after the WHERE SQL keyword) using named parameters for column values, as in: ‘origin_as=:oas’
  • w_parameters – an associative array with parameter values. Must be consistent with the names used for wquery, as in: {‘oas’: ‘28000’}
read_csv(w_fname)[source]¶

Load ROA data from RIPE batch validator CSV output.

Parameters:w_fname – file name of the CSV file to import.
stats(w_stat_name)[source]¶

Returns the value of one of several collected stats during CSV import. Returns None if w_stat_name does not exist.

Currently defined stat values are:

  • faled_inserts: how many INSERT statements failed during import
  • prefixes: how many prefixes were succesfully inserted into the in-memory database
Parameters:w_stat_name – named stat value.
